# {{< fa user-clock size=1x >}} &nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise (40 min)

## Accessing data

**Part 1**: Download the [PanTHERIA database](https://esajournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1890/08-1494.1), a species-level database of life history, ecology, and geography of extant and recently extinct mammals available [here](https://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/PanTHERIA_1-0_WR05_Aug2008.txt).

  {{< fa lightbulb >}} &nbsp; Use the function [`download.file()`](https://rdrr.io/r/utils/download.file.html) download the dataset

<br />

**Part 2**: Download GBIF occurrences for two bat species endemic to the islands of New Zealand: 

- _Mystacina tuberculata_ (New Zealand lesser short-tailed bat) &nbsp;[{{< fa brands wikipedia-w >}}](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand_lesser_short-tailed_bat)
- _Chalinolobus tuberculatus_ (New Zealand long-tailed bat) &nbsp;[{{< fa brands wikipedia-w >}}](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Zealand_long-tailed_bat)

  {{< fa lightbulb >}} &nbsp; Use the function [`rgbif::occ_search()`](https://docs.ropensci.org/rgbif/reference/occ_search.html).<br/>
  {{< fa triangle-exclamation >}} &nbsp; **Do not forget to export the data**.

<br />

**Bonus A**: Download New Zealand boundaries from <https://gadm.org/> (**GeoJSON Level 0**).

  {{< fa lightbulb >}} &nbsp; Use the function [`download.file()`](https://rdrr.io/r/utils/download.file.html).

<br/>

**Bonus B**: Plot a New Zealand map with GBIF occurrences.

  {{< fa lightbulb >}} &nbsp; Use the packages [`sf`](https://r-spatial.github.io/sf/) and [`ggplot2`](https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/).

  


## Correction


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width=50%}
**Part 1**

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

## Download administrative boundaries of NZL ----

gadm_url <- "https://geodata.ucdavis.edu/gadm/gadm4.1/json/"
filename <- "gadm41_NZL_0.json"

download.file(url      = paste0(gadm_url, filename), 
              destfile = filename,
              mode     = "wb")
```

<br/>

**Part 2**

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

## Download GBIF occurrences ----

species_names <- c("Mystacina tuberculata", 
                   "Chalinolobus tuberculatus")

occ <- rgbif::occ_search(scientificName     = species_names, 
                         fields             = "minimal",
                         hasCoordinate      = TRUE,
                         hasGeospatialIssue = FALSE)


## Append occurrences -----

occ <- rbind(occ$`Mystacina tuberculata`$"data",
             occ$`Chalinolobus tuberculatus`$"data")
```
:::

::: {.column width=50%}
**Part 2 (continued)**

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

## Export occurrences ----

write.csv(x         = occ, 
          file      = "gbif_occurrences.csv", 
          row.names = FALSE)
```

<br/>

**Part 3**

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

## Download PanTHERIA database ----

esa_url  <- "https://esapubs.org/archive/ecol/E090/184/"
filename <- "PanTHERIA_1-0_WR05_Aug2008.txt"

download.file(url      = paste0(esa_url, filename), 
              destfile = filename,
              mode     = "wb")
```
:::

## Correction

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width=50%}
**Bonus**

```{r}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false

## Import NZL shapefile ----

nzl <- sf::st_read("gadm41_NZL_0.json") |> 
  sf::st_transform(crs = 27200)


## Convert occurrences into sf object ----

occ_sf <- occ |> 
  sf::st_as_sf(coords = c("decimalLongitude", "decimalLatitude"),
               crs    = 4326) |> 
  sf::st_transform(crs = 27200)


## Map occurrences ----

library("ggplot2")

ggplot() +
  
  geom_sf(data = nzl) +
  
  geom_sf(data = occ_sf, mapping = aes(color = scientificName)) +
  
  theme_bw()
```
:::
